result.execSummary:
All charges against Raheem M Rivera in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raheem M Rivera is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raheem M Rivera

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raheem M Rivera in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Raheem M Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Jury Trial.  State's witness is not available and the State is unable to proceed. Defense moves to dismiss the case. Court ordered case dismissed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Raheem M Rivera in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Raheem M Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 10-24-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.
filed.
State's Motion for Joinder, filed.
filed.
State's Motion In Limine, filed.

Defendant Raheem M Rivera in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 9-15-22 at 1:30 pm for final pretrial and 10-24-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Supervision Report 08-15-2022

Defendant Raheem M Rivera in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Report 07-19-2022

2:01 PM Defendant Raheem M Rivera in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing at 8:30am. Defendant failed to appear; a bench warrant was issued. Defendant is now present with counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 5000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.O.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
Defendant Raheem M Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Attorney Cerniglia to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision.

Defendant Raheem M Rivera in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Raheem M Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
Defense motion to dismiss "Domestic Abuse Repeater" as to counts 1 AND 2.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Court will schedule case with defendant's other case.  Case adjourned, Br. PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
